However, while such incidents may hinder human bravery at first, I believe that daring actions are essential to achieve greater success.

  

A major benefit of taking risks is that it allows human beings to step out of the playground of mediocrity and push the boundaries of possibilities. This is to say that risk-takers usually view challenges as learning opportunities rather than a peril to stay away from and despite initial fear and uncertainties, it is quite rewarding to see their dedication bear fruit at the end. In fact, no historical figure has ever made a difference by playing it safe and being mediocre but they chose to take calculated risks. Take the founder of Ford as an example, he would have never invented the automobile if he had listened to the naysayers and refused to improve the engine from time to time until it became the renowned Ford cars we see today. Therefore, I am of the opinion that without trying new things, no greatness is accomplished.

In conclusion, although ventures in personal and professional life can be dangerous to some extent, people should consider taking risks as a requisite for success. For all the reasons above, the benefits of having an adventurous mind outweigh its drawbacks. <END_E>

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
<START_Q> The spread of multinational companies and the increase of globalization produces positive effects for everyone. To what extent do you agree or disagree? <END_Q> 
 <START_E> 'It is argued that the proliferation of global corporations and internationalization offers benefits to all people. I agree with the aforementioned statement because of reasons relating to a higher level of employment and enhanced cross-cultural communication skills.

Firstly, this trend brings more job opportunities for local residents. Since international firms, which open their branches in different countries, require a high level of workforce, they will need to recruit more local employees to operate the business. As a result, the natives are offered a decent occupation with lucrative incomes to cover their living expenses and in some cases, spend more generously on their shopping. For example, Samsung, a renowned Korean technology corporation, has created a large number of jobs for Vietnamese since 2018, through cooperating with the local government to successfully tackle the high unemployment rate in Vietnam.

Secondly, people have a chance to develop multicultural communication skills as globalization is promoted. On a personal level, it is now easy for workers to learn about foreign cultures and customs, enabling them to acquire more knowledge and insight into varying international practices. As they are exposed to cross-cultural diversity in their working environment and society, they  become more able to show  empathy and tolerate cultural differences. At the company level, globalization leads to a more diverse range of potential business partners and diversifies their investment portfolios, which contributes to their profit generation. Consequently, having global partnerships is essential for businesses to compete in the growing international market.

However, it is important to acknowledge that globalization itself is a threat to local businesses. With the impact of globalization, more and more new products are becoming available in the market and people have choices. In other words, there is greater competition in the market. Thus, local trades, particularly small and medium businesses might not survive in the long run and this has negative consequences on the local economy. 

In conclusion, although I acknowledge the positive impacts of multinational companies and globalization, such as more jobs in local areas and better cross-cultural communication, the negative consequences on local business cannot be ignored. This requires implementing policies and regulations that promote sustainable development and support domestic enterprises while harnessing the opportunities presented by globalization. <END_E>

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
<START_Q> Ordinary people try to copy famous personalities by seeing them on TV or reading about them in the newspapers.

What is the reason for this?

Is it a good idea to copy famous personalities? <END_Q> 
 <START_E> 'Nowadays, a lot of individuals tend to imitate some celebrities they see online or read about in the newspapers. The essay below will discuss the reason for doing so and state whether this tendency is good or bad.

First and foremost, several media platforms award content creators. For this reason, some citizens try to copy famous personalities seen on different social net as a way to increase viewership. More views mean more money. For instance, many people these days imitate the personalities of influential stars and post such videos and pictures on different online platforms like TikTok, Facebook, and YouTube. If  this kind of  content is viewed by many, the owner is paid decent money.  

Furthermore, seeing that most countries have unstable economies and numerous youngsters  are unemployed. Copying famous one's characters is not a bad tendency as it helps citizens who are not employed to get a living. For instance, a study in Zimbabwe by Runga found that more than 45 per cent of youths who have no jobs depend on creating content online. Some of the youngsters interviewed said this helped them to stay away from drugs as it kept them busy. They also mentioned that the money they got motivated them to do more scripts. Thus, copying  someone is a good move as it helps in putting food on the table. 

To conclude, certain individuals copy their idols seen on different social networks as a way of making funds for a living since most of them are not working. This is not a bad move because they make clean cash. These and other issues are discussed above at length. <END_E>

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
<START_Q> In many countries nowadays, people in big cities prefer to live alone or in small family units rather than larger, extended family groups. Is it a positive or negative trend? <END_Q> 
 <START_E> 'The number of people opting to reside in small apartments by themselves has been steadily increasing. While some argue that the disadvantages of this trend outweigh its merits, I firmly believe that it is a positive development as it signifies positive personal growth and economic development.

Living alone or with a small family allows individuals to experience greater freedom and personal space. It becomes more convenient for them to engage in their passions and hobbies outside of work without being accountable to extended family members. In a nuclear family, which is small by nature, responsibilities are divided and assigned, enabling family members to dedicate more time to pursuing their interests. Furthermore, when living independently, individuals do not have to concern themselves with the opinions or responsibilities of other family members. This provides them with additional time for reflection and self-improvement, which is crucial for personal growth.

Moreover, economic stability plays a significant role in the decision to live in a small family or independently. It is notably easier to manage financial responsibilities when living alone or with a partner and only one child. This allows for better financial planning, as it can provide a higher quality of life for their children and savings for emergencies. Additionally, living independently encourages individuals to develop essential life skills such as personal financial management, household chores, cooking, and shopping. Independent living also means not having to provide for other family members continually, which helps avoid excessive expenses.

In conclusion, I am confident that the trend toward smaller households and independent living is beneficial for society as a whole. It offers increased personal space and freedom, along with financial advantages and valuable life skills. <END_E>

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
<START_Q> Many animal species in the world are becoming extinct nowadays. Some people say that countries and individuals should protect these animals from dying out, while others say we should concentrate more on the problems of human beings. Discuss both views and give your own opinion. <END_Q> 
 <START_E> 'It is true that these days, many wild animals are on the verge of extinction. Thus, many people argue that authorities and individuals should contribute to the conservation of these species. Meanwhile, there is also a widespread belief that priority should be given to human welfare. In this essay, both sides will be explored, followed by my opinion.

On the one hand, the idea that countries and individuals should protect these animals from dying out is grounded in certain valid points. Firstly, endangered animals are often keystone species within ecosystems, playing critical roles in maintaining biodiversity and ecological balance. Their extinction can lead to cascading effects throughout the ecosystem, ultimately impacting human well-being through disrupted ecosystem services. Secondly, many believe that humans have a moral obligation to protect  wildlife from extinction, especially due to the fact that human activity is a primary cause of the decline of many species. Animals have intrinsic value and a right to exist independent of their usefulness to humans. Additionally, preserving biodiversity ensures that future generations can appreciate the beauty and diversity of life on Earth.

On the other hand, some argue that resources should be directed towards addressing pressing human needs, including poverty, hunger, and healthcare, rather than conservation efforts. In many parts of the world, such as parts of sub-Saharan Africa, the human population faces severe challenges like poverty, famine, epidemics, and natural disasters, with citizens struggling to secure basic necessities amidst prolonged droughts and food shortages. If a government allocates a significant portion of its budget to animal conservation efforts at the expense of addressing pressing human needs, local communities may face devastating consequences, intensifying difficulties in making a living and sparking ethical debates about prioritizing wildlife over the immediate well-being of its people.

In conclusion, while it is essential to address human needs and alleviate suffering, I believe that protecting endangered animals is not mutually exclusive to addressing human-centric issues. Both can and should be pursued simultaneously, as they are interconnected. Preserving biodiversity is crucial for maintaining the health and resilience of ecosystems, which ultimately support human well-being. Moreover, many conservation efforts can have positive economic impacts, contributing to sustainable development and poverty alleviation. <END_E>

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
<START_Q> For centuries, important parts of education have remained, such as reading, writing and maths. With the advent of computers, some people think that computer skills be made us a fourth skill to be added to the list. To what extent do you agree? <END_Q> 
 <START_E> 'The traditional material of education including reading, writing and maths is being speculated to shift by many, with a growing regard for computer science as a necessary concept, a new idea in training students. In this essay, I will advocate this idea and explain my reasons in favour of this phenomenon.

In the present day, computers have become a ubiquitous device that affects several sections of our lives. Without having essential knowledge of computer skills, we probably have a lot of troubles in our daily routines. Computers have also become an integral part of most  jobs. Accountants, teachers, and bank clerks are only a few of many examples of this reality.

Furthermore,  digital technology is replacing the other types of communication methods. The emergence of computers  gives many an opportunity to talk and see each other at the same time, a precious capability that makes an enormous contribution to saving our time and resources. For example,  meetings can be easily held with the attendants from different places of the world with just a few clicks.

Last but not least,  computers have had a deep effect on the other sciences. With aid of the computers, many calculations in maths, and engineering can be done in the blink of an eye. In this respect, progress in these sciences can be accelerated considerably. For instance, constructing a massive building or skyscraper has been possible just because  the software does heavy arithmetic calculations.

To summarize, learning computer skills is a must for most  people. Teaching basic instructions in schools will enable the students to be more prolific and successful in their future social lives and careers. Computers can facilitate the process of communication and reduce the waste of  time and  money. The extraordinary potential of computing has made these intelligent devices a good aid in  the process of research and development. All in all, it seems that unless one doesn't know how to work with a computer, they will be considered illustrated. <END_E>

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
<START_Q> Some people feel that entertainers such as film stars, pop musicians, or sports stars are paid too much money.

Do you agree or disagree?

Which other types of jobs should be highly paid? <END_Q> 
 <START_E> 'Some people think that the salaries of famous musicians, movie stars, and sports celebrities are too high. This essay discusses why I agree with the statement and which other careers should be paid more.

I strongly agree that celebrities' salaries are too high. This is because their earnings are disproportionally higher than those of non-known artists. For instance, I am at the beginning of my artistic career and, very often, I find myself struggling to pay rent and other essential bills. Another reason why I think this statement is true is that most well-known entertainer often spends a lot of cash on luxury products. The reason for this might be that they are constantly trying to prove their social status by purchasing futile items, such as jewellery, cars, or mansions.

On the other hand, other careers should earn more. The first of these are health-related positions, such as doctors, nurses, and dentists. This is because people's lives depend on this type of work and therefore, they should be paid accordingly. Another profession that should have a higher wage is educators, such as schoolteachers. The reason for this is that education is one of the most important pillars of a developed society. Consequently, educational workers' pay should be higher due to their responsibility to the country's teaching system.

In conclusion, my reasons to believe that celebrities are paid too much are that they receive a disproportional amount of cash in comparison to beginner artists and that they are often keen on spending their salaries on luxury items. The professions that should be paid a lot more than they usually do are health-related positions and educators. <END_E>

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
<START_Q> In their advertising, businesses nowadays usually emphasise that their products are new in some way. 

Why is this? Do you think it is a positive or negative development? <END_Q> 
 <START_E> 'These days various companies are producing new advertisements regarding their brand-new goods that are not frequently seen compared to the past. To me, this is because, in today's world, new products are more eye-catching to notions than what they have previously seen, so they tend to buy them. Therefore, I believe that it is a negative development, due to a variety of reasons.

First and foremost, advertisements are going in a direction that depicts a brand that has produced an interesting new product that has not been seen before. This is because, individuals are becoming more interested in things that are somehow unique, which brings curiosity for them to try them. In this case, businesses are putting more effort into coming up with new ideas, to improve their trade and earn more money. For example, makeup brands are now producing brand-new makeup every day to get people's attention to try them out, and also this can not be done without proper advertising. Furthermore, they will spend a great amount of their money on advertisements to bring up the notions of curiosity.

From my perspective, this statement holds various drawbacks, due to the fact that much more primary materials will be used for fulfilling society's needs. This situation will destroy the environment by providing raw materials that can be extremely harmful to nature, as this process requires extra effort and a great amount of energy will be wasted. On the other hand, this might cause wasting money on unnecessary products while the old ones work properly. This method, moreover, is a way to brainwash people into spending their bucks for company growth. On the contrary, the result of purchasing these products is consumerism which has significant disadvantages, as individuals might not be satisfied with their belongings and always try to reach for more.

To sum up, I hold the belief that advertising to get society's attention to purchase a new product might be beneficial for the companies as it will bring undeniable damage to the economy and our minds, to pursue more than what is needed. <END_E>

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
<START_Q> At the present time, the popualtion of some countries includes a relatively large number of young adults, compared with the number of older people. 

Do the advantages of this situation outweigh the disadvantages? <END_Q> 
 <START_E> 'Nowadays,we can observe that the number of residents comprises a significantly large amount of youngsters in comparison with elder adults. I firmly believe that the advantages outweigh the disadvantages.

This essay will look at the benefits and drawbacks of this situation.

On the negative side, the higher amount of adolescents can be an issue for the government, specifically in the case of the ability to pay. Moreover, young people apply for medical treatment much less often than elder people, which can negatively affect the turnover of the hospitals  and considerably decrease medical progress in the countries. To give an illustration, according to the statistics of the Eurasian National University, there is a piece of evidence that in most cases 50+ years old adults start to have medical check-ups and use other medical services.

On the positive side, the main advantages of a large number of youngsters can influence the economy's prosperity and a stronger workforce. Besides, young individuals have more abilities to work and bring benefits to the economy of the country.For instance, the average age of the population in Kazakhstan is around 30 years, which positively impacts the social development of the country. What is more, it is undeniable that each country takes into account the possibility of potential wars and organizes the appropriate preparation, therefore  young citizens are in demand of those kinds of situations. 

In conclusion, it can hardly be denied that there are negative sides to increasing  the young population but nevertheless, the benefits outweigh the drawbacks for several reasons mentioned in the reason. <END_E>

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
<START_Q> In many countries, traditional customs are being lost.

Why would this happen?

What do you think school and parent should do to keep these custom alive? <END_Q> 
 <START_E> 'In contemporary times, many nations are undergoing the elimination of their own cultures. This essay attempts to shed light on the driving factors behind this phenomenon before outlining several viable solutions that should be adopted to tackle it.

There are two primary reasons why local customs are disappearing in numerous territories. First and foremost, the development of international tourism could badly affect local communities. To be more specific, an increase in the number of tourists means higher demands for touring services such as hotels, restaurants, and transportation. As a result, individuals who work in craft villages are likely to switch their careers to pursue jobs involved in travelling fields, thereby leading to the extinction of traditional occupations and other unique handmade products. Furthermore, the evolution of the Internet and the digital era could harm regional citizens. This is because Western culture is becoming prevalent in social media, which could have an influence that encourages locals to change their lifestyles, such as clothes, the colour of their hair, or hobbies, as they try to imitate foreigners.

To protect the traditional customs against negative effects from alien cultures, the following essential steps should be taken. One remedy is that government bodies could pass some laws to maintain domestic occupations. For example, authorities could establish funding to improve craftsmen's salaries as well as introduce their special goods to the world, which could not only help the locals have better lives but also create a sustainable tourism industry. Another remedy is that the government could increase citizens' awareness about their values and histories. By providing more cultural lessons in schools or publishing magazines and news about historical sites or scenic spots as actions of conservation, thereby enhancing the country's imagination in the public eye as well as enriching individuals' patriotism.

In conclusion, there are some underlying motives behind this negative tendency, and it is crucial that the aforementioned measures be implemented to deal with this issue. <END_E>

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
<START_Q> Some people believe that everyone has the right to have access to university education and that governments should make it free for all students no matter what financial background they have.

To what extent do you agree or disagree ? <END_Q> 
 <START_E> 'People have different views as to whether university education should be free for everyone regardless of financial status. Despite the fact that there are drawbacks to providing free university education, I believe that it brings about much more benefits. 

On the one hand, there are three main reasons  why governments should not offer free university education to citizens. Firstly, the budget could be used on other more important things such as healthcare and infrastructure to ensure a higher standard of living for citizens. Secondly, the rich can easily afford to pay for their college education, so it would be unnecessary for governments to support them. Finally, not all governments can afford to cover university education costs because there would be too much financial burden to bear. This is especially true in times of financial crisis like the subprime crisis in 2008 when budgets were cut severely.

However, there are benefits to making university education accessible for all citizens. Free and quality higher education should be the basic right of every citizen since they pay taxes in one of the other ways to the government. This will also promote equality and reduce inequality among the rich and the poor where there is a widening income gap. By ensuring equal opportunities and an adequate living standard for all people, the crime rate will be much lower. Moreover, free university education would provide students with a fresh start since many young people in the US have a huge student loan debt.

In conclusion, I firmly believe that the advantages of offering free university education for all citizens far outweigh the disadvantages. <END_E>

instruction: Grading IELTS Writing Task 2 based on 4 criteria: coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, grammatical range, and task achievement.
input:
<START_Q> Plastic shopping bags are used widely and cause many environmental problems. Some people say they should be banned. To what extent do you agree or disagree? <END_Q> 
 <START_E> 'The question of whether the use of rubber bags, which are widely used across the globe for shopping, ought to be restricted, since it is not eco-friendly has sparked a substantial debate. While many advocate for this, which I firmly agree with, others argue against it. Analyzing these facts that it is non-biodegradable, as well as dangerous to aquatic life, would give a comprehensive overview of this subject matter.

Firstly, polyethene bags can neither decompose nor can they be recycled after use, so they are often trashed. For instance, the research report, from my recently completed capstone project on environmental analysis, shows that these bags are left to litter the streets since the dump sites are filled up and there is no other alternative means of disposal. Obviously, this can only be controlled if the production is stopped. Therefore, banning the use of plastic bags, in shopping centres is the only means of stopping this.

Secondly, most marine life dies as a result of digesting these bags, which are often dumped into the oceans. For example, the frozen catfish I purchased a few days ago, has nylon twisted in the stomach which killed it. Clearly, most aquatic life would be saved if the use of polythene bags were banned completely. Thus, one of the reasons why Poly plastic bags should be banned.

In conclusion, the argument surrounding whether plastic bags used for shopping  should be banned  because they cause damage to the environment has prompted considerable dispute. Some champion this idea, which I completely support, whereas others contend against it. Examining the factuality that it is non-recyclable and dangerous to  marine species, has proved the need for total eradication of these bags by the authorities. <END_E>
